verses.verse: A Book of RemembranceThen those (Ps. 66:16) who feared the LORD (Heb. 3:13) spoke to one another, And the LORD listened and heard them; So (Ps. 56:8) a book of remembrance was written before Him For those who fear the LORD And who meditate on His name.

“They (Ex. 19:5; Deut. 7:6; Is. 43:21; (1 Pet. 2:9)) shall be Mine,” says the LORD of hosts, “On the day that I make them My (Is. 62:3) jewels. And (Ps. 103:13) I will spare them As a man spares his own son who serves him.”
((Ps. 58:11)) Then you shall again discern Between the righteous and the wicked, Between one who serves God And one who does not serve Him.

The Great Day of God “For behold, (Ps. 21:9; (Nah. 1:5, 6; Mal. 3:2, 3; 2 Pet. 3:7)) the day is coming, Burning like an oven, And all (Mal. 3:18) the proud, yes, all who do wickedly will be (Is. 5:24; Obad. 18) stubble. And the day which is coming shall burn them up,” Says the LORD of hosts, “That will (Amos 2:9) leave them neither root nor branch.

But to you who (Mal. 3:16) fear My name The (Matt. 4:16; Luke 1:78; Acts 10:43; 2 Cor. 4:6; Eph. 5:14) Sun of Righteousness shall arise With healing in His wings; And you shall go out And grow fat like stall-fed calves.
(Mic. 7:10) You shall trample the wicked, For they shall be ashes under the soles of your feet On the day that I do this,” Says the LORD of hosts.
“Remember the (Ex. 20:3) Law of Moses, My servant, Which I commanded him in Horeb for all Israel, With (Deut. 4:10) the statutes and judgments.
Behold, I will send you ((Matt. 11:14; 17:10-13; Mark 9:11-13; Luke 1:17); John 1:21) Elijah the prophet (Joel 2:31) Before the coming of the great and dreadful day of the LORD.
And he will turn The hearts of the fathers to the children, And the hearts of the children to their fathers, Lest I come and (Zech. 14:12) strike the earth with (Zech. 5:3) a curse.”

The Genealogy of Jesus Christ The book of the (Luke 3:23) genealogy of Jesus Christ, (2 Sam. 7:12-16; Ps. 132:11; Is. 9:6; 11:1; Jer. 23:5; (Matt. 1:18; Luke 3:23, 31); John 7:42; Acts 2:30; (Rom. 1:3); Rev. 22:16) the Son of David, (Gen. 12:3; 22:18; (Gal. 3:16)) the Son of Abraham:
(Gen. 21:2, 12) Abraham begot Isaac, (Gen. 25:26; 28:14) Isaac begot Jacob, and Jacob begot (Gen. 29:35) Judah and his brothers.
(Gen. 38:27; 49:10) Judah begot Perez and Zerah by Tamar, (Ruth 4:18-22; 1 Chr. 2:1-15; Matt. 1:3-6) Perez begot Hezron, and Hezron begot Ram.
Ram begot Amminadab, Amminadab begot Nahshon, and Nahshon begot Salmon.
Salmon begot (Ruth 2:1; 4:1-13) Boaz by Rahab, Boaz begot Obed by Ruth, Obed begot Jesse,
and (1 Sam. 16:1; Is. 11:1, 10) Jesse begot David the king. (2 Sam. 7:12; 12:24; Is. 9:7) David the king begot Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah.
(1 Kin. 11:43; 1 Chr. 3:10) Solomon begot Rehoboam, Rehoboam begot (2 Chr. 11:20) Abijah, and Abijah begot Asa.
Asa begot (1 Chr. 3:10) Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat begot Joram, and Joram begot (2 Kin. 15:13) Uzziah.
Uzziah begot Jotham, Jotham begot (2 Kin. 15:38) Ahaz, and Ahaz begot Hezekiah.
(2 Kin. 20:21) Hezekiah begot Manasseh, Manasseh begot Amon, and Amon begot (1 Kin. 13:2) Josiah.
(1 Chr. 3:15, 16) Josiah begot Jeconiah and his brothers about the time they were (2 Kin. 24:14-16; Jer. 27:20; Matt. 1:17) carried away to Babylon.
And after they were brought to Babylon, (1 Chr. 3:17) Jeconiah begot Shealtiel, and Shealtiel begot (Ezra 3:2; Neh. 12:1; Hag. 1:1) Zerubbabel.
Zerubbabel begot Abiud, Abiud begot Eliakim, and Eliakim begot Azor.
Azor begot Zadok, Zadok begot Achim, and Achim begot Eliud.
Eliud begot Eleazar, Eleazar begot Matthan, and Matthan begot Jacob.
And Jacob begot Joseph the husband of (Matt. 13:55; Mark 6:3) Mary, of whom was born Jesus who is called Christ.
